column8: The game is relaxing and enjoyable, perfect for those who love interior design and decorating.
column9: The snapping and placement mechanics are frustrating and inaccurate.

column8: The game has a lot of potential and is expected to improve with future updates.
column9: The game has numerous bugs and crashes frequently.

column8: There are some bugs and optimization issues, but they are manageable and expected in early access.
column9: The game is not optimized well, leading to performance issues.

column8: The game offers a variety of customization options for furniture and room design.
column9: There is a lack of customization options for furniture and room dimensions.

column8: The story mode includes interesting puzzles and tasks that keep the gameplay fresh.
column9: The controls and user interface are not intuitive or user-friendly.

column8: The sandbox mode allows for creative freedom and extensive customization.
column9: The game feels incomplete and lacks content.

column8: The graphics and lighting are aesthetically pleasing and add to the overall experience.
column9: The story mode and mini-games are not engaging or fun.

column8: The game is compared favorably to other interior design games like The Sims and House Flipper.
column9: The game is not suitable for realistic room planning due to restrictive mechanics.

column8: Players appreciate the ability to mod and the potential for future content through updates.
column9: The graphics and visual design are not appealing to many players.

column8: Some players have experienced issues with controls and UI, but overall find the game intuitive and fun.
column9: The game has potential but needs significant updates and improvements.

column8:
Во многих позитивных отзывах на эту вещь сказано нечто вроде: да, это ранний доступ, все криво, но у нее ЕСТЬ ПОТЕНЦИАЛ.

Так вот, я уточню: БЫЛ потенциал. Когда вышло последнее обновление? Правильно, в середине 2015 года. И все, тишина. Продукт заброшен. Печальная и, в общем-то, обычная судьба многих игрушек в раннем доступе -- ну надоело разработчикам с ней возиться.

А может случиться так, что авторы к ней еще вернутся? Теоретически, да. Ничего не мешает. Но я бы на это рассчитывать не стал.

Брать, или нет? Нет. Но если в этом году выйдет хоть одно обновление, то возможно, мое мнение изменится. Но ведь не выйдет...
column9:
Many positive reviews of this game say something like: yes, it's Early Access, everything's a bit clunky, but it HAS POTENTIAL.

So, let me clarify: it WAS potential. When was the last update released? That's right, in mid-2015. And then, silence. The product is abandoned. A sad and, generally speaking, common fate for many games in Early Access – the developers just got tired of messing with it.

But could it be that the developers will return to it? Theoretically, yes. Nothing prevents them from doing so. But I wouldn't count on it.

Should I buy it or not? No. But if even one update comes out this year, maybe my opinion will change. But it won't...

Чёт игра не очень((((  Я понимаю, что эта ранний доступ, но 
даже для раннего доступа,слишком сыро....

У неё ужаснейшая оптимизация, ставишь "Экстрим" настройки игра умудряется тормозить на топовом компе (СyК@ 1 - 8 Fps)

Все не доделано до ума, часть локации недоступно, по воде ходишь  как  Иисус...

В мульке лоступен только один режим и там нет народу...

Нету настроек управления и звука

Один плюс этой игре есть: 1) САУНДТРЕК  2) Оформление карты и дизайн, но этого мало(((((((((

Итого: 8 FPS из 100
column9:
The game isn't exactly great. I understand it's Early Access, but 
even for Early Access, it's too raw...

It has terrible optimization; even with the "Extreme" settings, the game manages to lag on a high-end computer (CyK@ 1 - 8 FPS).

Everything is unfinished, some locations are inaccessible, you walk on water like Jesus...

There's only one mode available in the game, and there are no people there...

No control or sound settings.

This game has one positive: 1) The soundtrack 2) The map design and layout, but that's not enough.

Total: 8 FPS out of 100

column8:
Let me start off my saying, I am no stranger to Early Access games. I know what im buying and I know what to expect. 

Now, there are some games that are in early access and pretty nice. They might have some graphical issues or multiplayer issues. And you can usually get the point of the game. Im having a hard time trying to figure out what im supposed to be doing in Damned Nation. Im supposed to build this "Home Hub" which takes materials that you need to gather. But the only thing you can harvest is wood and stone. You need to loot the metal and fuel. And the only loot that spawns is in garbage cans and broken vehicles. There are houses that you can enter, but they are really really dark and there is never anything in them. Once the Home Hub was placed (finally) this huge blue aura appears. Then you can start building turrets within it. So I place one (after running all around looting every car in sight) and it doesn't work. I lured 3 zeds in  front of it and it did nothing. The zeds just beat the shit out of it. There is a power counter that appears in the top left corner, but you are never told how you are supposed to turn on the turrets. So at this point, I was lost. So I stopped.   The lack of direction is probably the biggest downfall this game currently.

And when it comes to killing things..im not sure where im supposed to be hitting the zeds. The hit boxes appear to be completely random. I could be standing right in front of one gettin my face chewed off while I swing my axe at it, but 95% of the time you do no damage. So I just ran and jumped around them. Even tho there is a leveling system, I felt no desire to stand around and try to kill zombies. 

SO, at the games current state I can't recommend it. I love my survival games but the survival mode in this just isn't there. And there is too much lack of direction or information to keep it from being frustrating. 

And once again, I know this is early access, and I know what I was getting into when I bought this.

column8:
I love the design concept.  However at this point:

 It is in early Alpha, if that.  This game won't be ready for Beta, much less release for months yet.  In it's current state it is almost unplayable and there's so many obvious problems to fix that it doesn't seem that even outside alpha testers would be needed yet.  When it gets to where it seems like outside alpha testers would be doing more than just falling over each other with the obvious problems I'll update my recommendation to a thumbs up.



I apologize for accidentally misrepresenting it's release timeline when I first commented, I must have misread as it's just the next alpha that is being released this month.

column8:
I cannot recommend this game at this time (June 2015).

I appreciate the efforts of people who work hard to create and improve games released under Early Access.   I also accept the uneven quality and inevitable ups and downs of developing games, responding to the criticisms and suggestions of players, and working to make fixes and patches that improve an Early Access game.  I don't expect miracles or perfection, and I am willing to be patient with an Early Access game.

Based on my experience with various other Early Access games, I think this game still needs a lot of work, and the pace of its fixes and improvements has been a bit slow.  I wish the developers luck and success, but suggest that any potential buyers seriously consider waiting for more improvements before buying this game.

column8:
von sommer 2017
Das Spiel wird leidernicht mehr weiter geführt. ist noch auf dem selben stand wie ich es damals gekauft habe. Schade drum, aber leider keine seltenheit.


Von 2015

Das ganze spiel läuft bis her sehr gut.
Der TD modus selber ist ehr lahm da die Gegener nur gerade aus laufen und man so nicht wirklich zusehen muss wo man die Tower hinstellt.

Der eigendliche Teile des Spiel ist mal etwas erfrischend.
Man kämpft in der Ego Perspektive und muss 3 Punkte verteidigen.
Momentan kann man seine Tower oder barikaden mit EXP Bauen und seine Gesundheit kann man mit dem Töten von Tieren auffüllen.
Das ganze ist derzeit eine Runde sache, Bugs usw sind natürlich vorhanden, aber für eine Alpha läuft es besser wie manch Fertige spiele von anderen Abietern.

Der Multiplayermodus ist im Aufbau, man kann zwar ne runde spielen drinnen aber ist oft alleine ^^

Für den preis eine gute sache und bisher macht es mir großen spass.
column9:
From summer 2017
Unfortunately, the game is no longer being developed. It's still at the same level as when I bought it. It's a shame, but unfortunately, it's not uncommon.

From 2015

The whole game is running very well so far.
The TD mode itself is rather slow, as the enemies only run straight ahead, so you don't really have to watch where you're placing your towers.

The actual part of the game is somewhat refreshing.
You fight in first-person perspective and have to defend three points.
Currently, you can build your towers or barricades with EXP, and you can replenish your health by killing animals.
The whole thing is currently a round-robin affair; there are, of course, bugs, etc., but for an alpha, it's running better than some finished games from other providers.

The multiplayer mode is still under development. You can play a round indoors, but you're often alone. ^^

It's a good deal for the price, and I'm having a lot of fun with it so far.

column8:
*Update* 
Mitlerweile tut sich rein gar nichts mehr. Die Devs scheinen dieses Spiel nicht mehr weiter zu entwickeln.
In der jetzigen Form wäre dieses "Spiel" selbst geschenkt zu teuer. Purer Scam.
Schade hatte potenzial.

*altes Review kurz nach Release*
Habe es für knapp 8€ gekauft und bin positiv Überrascht.
Die Spielwelt und Models sehen schön aus.
Der Nachträglich eingeführte MP Mode ist ok aber Ausbaufähig (daran wird auch schon gearbeitet).
Bisher ist der Content leider etwas mager, aber mal schauen was da noch so kommt.
Steht ja noch so einiges auf der todo Liste ^^
column9:
*Update*
Absolutely nothing's happening these days. The developers don't seem to be developing this game any further.
In its current form, this "game" would be too expensive even for free. Pure scam.
Too bad, it had potential.

*old review shortly after release*
I bought it for just under €8 and I'm pleasantly surprised.
The game world and models look nice.
The later-introduced multiplayer mode is okay but could be improved (they're already working on it).
Unfortunately, the content is a bit thin so far, but we'll see what else comes along.
There's still a lot on the to-do list ^^

Not bad, promising.
It's not a DayZ or a 7 Days to Die, but rather a tower defense game like 3D Zombies with missions and mods afterward.
Nevertheless, it's nice for what's presented in this alpha.

column8:
The game has lot's of work to be done on, but still the core mechanics are good and there is fun to be had, still it's very very limited as i speak.

What needs to be done imperatively :

-New animations for undeads and weapons.
-new sounds for both too.
-more levels and world variants.
-some good music.
-a coop mode.
-more ennemies types
-XP and level up
-make the graphics prettier, or at least do the best you can (to dev)
-better menu.
-remodel some weapons like the m16 who doesn't look so great.
-make the game slightlier faster.
-make better gore effects.
-possiblility to enter buildings and barricade them.
-sniper rifles should be added.
-and also bazookas.

Add all that and the game will be a lot better already.

I sure hope the dev read me and if so if he can reply.

I will maybe post this on forum later.

Mark. (TheDude47)

column8: I recommend this game, only on the fact that it will most certainly improve. Wait until it is more developed before forking out lots of money for this, because, and I hate to say it, at this current stage, it is mediocre at best. The only thing you can do is fortify at the moment, it comes with little to no instructions, a tutorial would be nice. If you must grab it, get it via the indiegala bundle. If you want a game that will make you rage quit because you keep dying repeatedly, (the zombies make hardly any noise and just wander up behind you and take all your health in a couple hits, while you use a whole clip of ammo to take down 1 out of the 4 zombies meandering towards you) then this is the game for you.

column8: Хоть многие и ругают Damned Nation Reborn почем зря, но, как по мне, игра получилась крайне интересной и надеждоподающей, если сравнивать ее с сотнями поделок, которые умирают на первый же день в раннем доступе. Несокрушимый форт мы пока не возведем, как и не поиграем с друзьями, но если вам это критично, то подождите пару месяцев, пока разработчик это не добавит. Вас же никто насильно играть не заставляет :) И да, оптимизация не так уж плоха! Но вот зомби, которые НЕ ХОТЯТ выходить - да, засранцы еще те, кхе
column9: Even though many criticize Damned Nation Reborn for no apparent reason, I think it's a very interesting and promising game compared to hundreds of other games that die on the first day of Early Access. We won't be able to build an impenetrable fort yet, nor will we be able to play with friends, but if that's a concern for you, wait a couple of months until the developer adds it. No one's forcing you to play :) And yes, the optimization isn't that bad! But the zombies that DON'T WANT to come out—yeah, they're real assholes, heh.

column8:
At first i wasnt sure as i was bug heaven BUT

I just updated the game and was shocked how much was done in a few hours.
As this developer listens to feed back and and improves the game in such short
time i am sure this game will be great when its done

This game is the perfect example of how a developer that listens can turn a game around.

Yes the game could do with improvements but it is in early access and im sure it will be great.

column8:
First Impressions:

In short, the game is most certainly not worth $13 at the present time.  There is only one game mode available and the game doesn't do a very good job in informing the player on how to actually play the game.  Yes, I did read the manual on the official website and while it tells you to hit "T" for turret and hit "1", "2", etc. to select your turret, it does not tell you how to actually place it.  All I get is the outline of the object with no indication on what to do next.  The hit-boxes are a bit off, especially with the shotgun...a zombie, in theory, should go down after five shots at point blank range.  The visuals are coming along nicely, though this game clearly needs more work.  With that said, I'll be happy to revisit the game again to see how it progresses throughout the course of development and change my recommendation appropriately.

Manual: http://www.damned-nation.co.uk/#/manual/4588310998

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFyJAqLsENw
